A careless admin used RSA with modulus from two Blum integers. Can you recover the secret from 2671581326375004082183307629418108871420272111346632904630332757243111733375192275097357136494054981241964748394558529508339784565050277272832883361536956?

The flag format is flag{...}
n=5211549045590209706844440726790034153008995014315455361847908724840169025671454287513746453568888168882336308934459948026360767364714383289733973219048009, e=3224398425755150870670231635933489325308280109907225846528336797014146381152090198717098100518581001252907814241690223783288317653434304828901791278228283
The lower 104 bits of p are: 43853725196576942410175127849498433903


---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{n6o5jx89}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 2671581326375004082183307629418108871420272111346632904630332757243111733375192275097357136494054981241964748394558529508339784565050277272832883361536956
vulnerability: blum integers
hint: Blum integers are products of primes congruent to 3 modulo 4. These integers have unique properties in cryptography.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=5211549045590209706844440726790034153008995014315455361847908724840169025671454287513746453568888168882336308934459948026360767364714383289733973219048009, e=3224398425755150870670231635933489325308280109907225846528336797014146381152090198717098100518581001252907814241690223783288317653434304828901791278228283
